intro: Gaultheria schultzei, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically red or black in color, containing a single seed. Gaultheria schultzei is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of alpine flora and ecological adaptations.
